title: Bitcoin, Match, Spotify, Invitation Homes: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; The cryptocurrency is ticking lower on the day it becomes an official currency in El Salvador
text:
* Bitcoin prices were down nearly 2% from their 5 p.m. ET level on Monday. El Salvador became the first country in the world to adopt bitcoin as legal tender on Tuesday, allowing Salvadorans to use the cryptocurrency to buy a cup of coffee, get a haircut or even pay taxes and home loans. But even if the crypto itself is inching lower, it seems investors in Coinbase Global like the idea: Its shares ticked up 0.8%.

* U.S.-traded shares of Spotify climbed 1.8% premarket. The stock was given an upgraded rating and a price target of $340 a share from Keybanc, after having closed Friday at $249.04.

* BioMarin Pharmaceutical shares dropped 7% ahead of the bell. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration placed a clinical hold on one of its gene therapy studies. The company is also pausing additional enrollment of participants outside the U.S.

* Invitation Homes dropped 2.2% premarket. The single-family-home leasing company said it recently received a letter from the Federal Trade Commission requesting information about how the company conducts its business generally and specifically during the Covid-19 pandemic.

* Boeing is losing a bit of altitude ahead of the bell, slipping 0.4%. Ryanair, Boeing's biggest customer outside of the U.S., said it is walking away from talks with the U.S. jet maker over a potential new order for the 737 MAX in a dispute over pricing.

* Casey's General Stores, Smartsheet and Coupa Software are due to report earnings after Tuesday's close.

Chart of the Day

* High-interest loans to house flippers are a hot commodity on Wall Street, but inventory is scarce.

Bitcoin, Match, Spotify, Invitation Homes: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
